text: No drivers, crew or other team members protested during the national anthem to start the NASCAR Cup series race after receiving warnings that they would be fired. Several team owners and executives had said they wouldn't want anyone in their organizations to protest at The National Association for Stock Car Auto Racing race in Loudon, New Hampshire, today. Richard Childress, who was Dale Earnhardt's longtime team owner, told the Associated Press :'It'll get you a ride on a Greyhound bus.'Childress, 72, says he told his team that'anybody that works for me should respect the country we live in. So many people gave their lives for it. This is America '. No drivers or crew members were seen protesting during the singing of the'Star - Spangled Banner, the United States national anthem
